page.title: 03River Management Lparish
page.content:
River Management L.parish
The stretch of{the Test}in our survey flows almost entirely through private land.The fishing rights are hired out. The landowner employs a{"water keeper" to manage the river{.Dredging}is carried out during the winter and {river weed is cut}in summer to keep the water flowing and prevent flooding .Non-mud collecting weed e.g. water crowfoot is not cut.Between{Nov} {and March electric fishing}stun pike and other trout predators is carried out.The pike are removed to man-made lakes for angling.{The river is {stocked with 1000 times 2-3lb trout {usually twice a year.}This costs between Â£2500 and Â£3000.These fish are heavier than normal river-bred trout of the same age.
